result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Krystle A Plotkin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Krystle A Plotkin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Krystle A Plotkin.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for Annie Louk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Motion hearing. Defendant was not produced for today's hearing, therefore the court is unable to proceed with a motion hearing at this time.  Court sets deadline of 11/7/2022 for State to file a response to Defense motion.  Defendant shall be produced from Waukesha County Jail for next hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence, filed.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Michael F Torphy appeared by video for Krystle A Plotkin.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense requests motion hearing date. Court orders Defense to notify the State and the Court at least one week prior to to the next hearing date the whereabouts of the Defendant so an OTP may be completed.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Motion hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court in person for Krystle A Plotkin.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: St. Francis PD Officer D. Platt. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 080411,
Payable Number: 1027496,
Receipt Number: 22RP033817,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

ADDRESS INFO for Krystle A Plotkin
Current: 1626 N 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: 2123 South 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Krystle A Plotkin appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
